column5: WATERS WERE UP BUT THE PERFECT STEELHEAD COLOUR!!! BITE WAS SLOW TODAY (WATER ABSOLUTELY FREEZING) BUT WERE ALL BIG FISH!!! MANAGED 4 AND A DROPBACK HEN!!! SHE DID HER JOB AND WAS ON THE WAY HOME(LAST 2 PICS) TILL THE NEXT TIME!!! (TOMOR IM HOPIN  LOL)
Wow....you astound me with your constant successes!  Makes me want to go out even more!!! thanks for the post...and awesome pics!
nice pics of some big fatties.
Nice job CC.  Absolutely beauty fish and pics.
Wow some real nice hogs.....beauty fish.
There are certainly some beauties once again....I hope the waters are not gin clear by Saturday....  Jason
Musta had your work cut out with those brutes, good stuff...
C.C. = Canadian Catcher!  Nice work on those trout.  Got to love dropping water levels!  Cheers, Tony
way to go bud   they sure are awsome looking fish,thanks for the report   CC.... cheers
TX ALL!!! GOD I LOVE HAVIN WINTERS OFF AT TIMES  LOL MY WIFES HAS HERE OWN OPINION BUT ITS NOT SUITABLE FOR OUR YOUNGER READERS LOL!!
pictures are to close back the camera up for a better picture so we can see the reel size but the fish are big and look healthy good catch
Those are some serious fish man, awsome pics

thnaks all again!!! jay the pics are taken back in full size with background and person!!! there just cropped so i dont give much away!!! (been there and done that yrs ago!! what a mistake that was)  plus at 285lbs even a 20lb bow looks small with me  LOL!!!
Good shooting CC.  A hen spawned ot in early January ? The weather must really be screwing up the fishes biological clock.

nice pics cc, but and Im not starting something but you now very well what mud does to those fish in the gills.  Give em a dunk and wash at least before the pic set a good example for any new steelheaders bud because mud and improper pics and fish handling kills a lot more then giving up the locations
THANKS LOU!! IN SOME SITUATIONS ITS JUST PART OF IT!!! YOU KNOW ME BETTER THEN THAT!!!
Awesome report CC, and nice pics.  Your report may get me to take my centerpin out of the basement, especially with no ice on the lakes!  Love the report.. keep 'em coming.  Aaron Shirley

I second that notion.  Sorry Scott, but that's the muddiest chrome I've ever seen...  I'm not questioning your skills as a steelheader, just your landing technique.  Ever try tailing instead of beaching?  These fish deserve your care and proper handling, just like your centerpin..  Besides, don't they look better clean and unblemished, rather than covered in muck?  cheers  Mcfiddler
